results.title: Flowers
results.brief_description:
The third music video / visual from iyla’s 2019 EP, the video ironically uses hypersaturated flowers to comment on the stereotypes of traditional male/female relationships.

Director/DP/Editor: Patrick “Embryo” Tapu

constellations_other.name: Flower on the wind
constellations_other.description: Explore the use of flowers in the moving image as an aesthetic and metaphor.

results.title: Flowergirl
results.creator_credit: Cate Shortland, Anthony Anderson and Red Carpet Productions
results.brief_description: Daisuke, Hana and Tetsu are three young Japanese tourists who share a flat in Sydney’s Bondi Beach. Daisuke has to return to Japan to work in his father’s butcher shop but his return is made bitter because of his falling in love with Hana. Featuring a fragmented narrative utilising video and 16mm film, this beautifully shot short film was voted the Best Short Film of 1999 by the Critic’s Circle of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cate Shortland, Anthony Anderson and Red Carpet Productions

results.title: Flower stories
results.creator_credit: Kate Canning, Terry Harding, Richard Price Television, Taurus-Film and HTV West
results.brief_description: A compilation of 8 animated stories aimed to entertain children aged between 3-9 years and featuring James, a fat black and white cat. The central theme for all the stories is “flowers”. Very colorful! Animation by Sue Allen. Storyteller: Alan Taylor.

results.title: Florence: cradle of the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: Leah Joy and Museum Television Workshop
results.brief_description: Narrated by Grace Jackman, with poetry and readings inspired by Florence, and read by Richard Levine, viewers are taken on an artistic travelogue of Florence, focusing primarily on the Renaissance. This commentary provides insight into the architectural and artistic wonders which are an integral part of Florence. From 1436 when Brunelleschi designed the dome of Santa Maria del Fiore, the next hundred years of the Renaissance were filled with seminal figures like Michelangelo, Botticelli, Ghiberti, Cellini, Donatello and Leonardo da Vinci; overlooked by the great patrons Cosimo and Lorenzo de Medici. This video enables the viewer to experience the masterpieces of Florence as an armchair traveller.

results.title: Flora: scenes from a leadership convention
results.creator_credit: Peter Raymont, Michael McKennirey, Roman Kroitor, Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A fresh, incisive look at Canadian politics, this film penetrates the surface glitter of the 1976 Progressive Conservative Party leadership convention, focusing on the campaign of Cape Bretoner Flora MacDonald, the first woman to contest her party’s leadership. (Follow-up film: Reflections on a Leadership Convention.)

results.title: Floods through fire
results.creator_credit: Lynda Code, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lynda Code recalls the hardships of living through the Gippsland bushfires then having to cope with devastating floods. Her story of resiliance is a tribute to her family, who have battled along with her. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
